1.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a criminal, or one accounted guilty
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

3.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
a leaf (as coming up on a tree); collectively, foliage
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to push forward, in various senses (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive)

4.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
a criminal, or one accounted guilty
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)
